fields.description:
As per requested by the customer, Jira could allow users to add projects to filters when the project is created. Something like this:

On project creation screen, add a button, a checkbox or a multiselect list with all filters and then allow users to select one or multiple filters, then add project key to the filter.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Allow the ability to automatically insert projects to filters

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At this moment, it is not possible to query events for a specific time span of the day, from a period of time.
For example: Show me the issues created in the last 6 months that were created between 17h00 and 08h00.
This won't be possible.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow a JQL query for a specific time span of the day, from a period of time.

h3. Why this is important
It is relevant to managers/admins to understand which time of day is the most intense of issue creation, for example.

h3. Workaround 
If needed, the admin can export the issues to a csv file and use the spread sheet editor (Office, OpenOffice, Numbers, etc) to perform the query.

 !JQL yay.png|thumbnail! 

 !JQL nay.png|thumbnail! 

 !Export to CSV.png|thumbnail! 

 !CSV exported.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Allow a JQL query for a specific time span of the day, from a period of time

fields.description:
On [Data storage FAQ|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/data-storage-faq-873871367.html] some parts are misleading for the customer, as it does not specify how backups work and can sometimes set the customer in the wrong direction.

For example 
{quote}Atlassian Cloud sites does not support the use of backup data to roll back changes.{quote}
This part seems like the customer would be unable to use her/his particular backup to restore the instance's data, giving an impression that we do not support backups at all.
fields.summary: Update "Data storage FAQ " backup description

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, user unable to view the last modified field on workflow page list. This feature has been removed once ADG3 is implemented.
fields.summary: Option to Add Last modified field on Workflow page list

fields.description:
The link issue between different JIRA instances is not available from the New JIRA Issue View.

To create one of these links, the users must either disable the New JIRA issue view or go to the  detail view. They can't do this type of links from the boards for example. It only show internal projects issues, the application links aren't included (yet) in the New view. 

Normal View link issue feature:
 !Screen Shot 2018-05-03 at 12.28.45.png|thumbnail! 

New JIRA Issue View link issue feature:
 !Screen Shot 2018-05-03 at 12.29.03.png|thumbnail! 

Could be useful to get this feature in the New view too and avoid moving to other screens just to create a link between issues from other JIRA instances
fields.summary: Add the link issue between different JIRA instance available from the New JIRA Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Summary

All Issues that has different update or no updated date in system gets updated to current date which breaks the board and report

h3. Expected Results
 * Nothing should get changed or updated unless if it is done manually or by an add-on
 * Previously updated ticket date should remain as it is.

h3. Actual Results
All issues gets updated to current date.
fields.summary: All issues incorrectly marked as updated
JIRA Cloud Slack Integration > Handle too many JIRA tickets in one message (produces a message of crazy sizes)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Some of the instructions as per following documentations do not match the new JIRA interface (JIRA's New Experience). The steps are misleading as some terms and steps mentioned it the knowledge bases differs with the options in the new interface of JIRA.

- [Resolutions are not set|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/resolutions-are-not-set-225122076.html]
- [HowTo: Bulk Edit Resolution|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/howto-bulk-edit-resolution-321857142.html]

e.g "Admin Panel" in following steps:
{quote}
*Set a Fixed Resolution*
# Browse to a project's *Admin Panel*.
#* Note the *Workflow Scheme*.
# Browse to *Workflow Schemes* from the Admin panel.
#* Note the corresponding *Workflow*.
# Select the workflow.
{quote}

h3. Suggested Solution
Please revise and update the instructions to match the new interface and be easier to follow.
fields.summary: Update documentations on "Resolutions are not set" and "HowTo: Bulk Edit Resolution"

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Attaching empty attachments (with 0 bytes) breaks the attachment section in the issue they were attached to, preventing any user from downloading any attachment in the issue.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue
# Create an empty file in your machine
#* A way to do that: {{touch empty.txt}}
# Attach the file to the issue

h3. Expected Results
File is displayed, though empty.

h3. Actual Results

The attachments section shows this error:
{code}
Error rendering 'com.atlassian.jira.jira-view-issue-plugin:attachmentmodule'. Please contact your Jira administrators.
{code}
!error.png|thumbnail!

The below exception is thrown in Jira logs:
{noformat}
msg: Media API should always return the Content-Type http header.	
     stack: java.lang.NullPointerException: Media API should always return the Content-Type http header.
	at java.util.Objects.requireNonNull(Objects.java:228)
	at com.atlassian.media.client.impl.HttpClientMediaApiClient$9.getContentType(HttpClientMediaApiClient.java:1056)
	at com.atlassian.jira.media.metric.MediaApiAnalyticsEventBuilder.lambda$processDownloadResult$0(MediaApiAnalyticsEventBuilder.java:80)
	at java.lang.Iterable.forEach(Iterable.java:75)
	at com.atlassian.jira.media.metric.MediaApiAnalyticsEventBuilder.processDownloadResult(MediaApiAnalyticsEventBuilder.java:80)
	at com.atlassian.jira.media.MediaApiServiceClientImpl.performRequest(MediaApiServiceClientImpl.java:326)
	at com.atlassian.jira.media.MediaApiServiceClientImpl.downloadOriginalFile(MediaApiServiceClientImpl.java:77)
	at com.atlassian.jira.media.DescribedMediaApiServiceClient.downloadOriginalFile(DescribedMediaApiServiceClient.java:55)
	at com.atlassian.jira.media.DescribedMediaApiServiceClient.downloadOriginalFile(DescribedMediaApiServiceClient.java:48)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.attachment.store.media.MediaApiAttachmentGetStrategy.lambda$getAttachmentData$1(MediaApiAttachmentGetStrategy.java:41)
	at java.util.Optional.map(Optional.java:215)
.....
[-]	
       location: java.util.Objects:requireNonNull	
       type: java.lang.NullPointerException	
{noformat}
 

h3.Workaround
# Click '...' >> Manage Attachments in 'Attachments section'
# Find all empty attachments (size = '0.0 kB')
# Delete them (keep note of the name or other data if you need)
fields.summary: Adding empty attachments to issues break attachment section

fields.description:
Currently and mostly in the history of my career, the projects set-up for my organizations are essentially clients and within are projects.  Is there now or is it on the backlog to add an indicator when setting up a new Project to identify the Project as Internal? 

The benefits are many that I'm happy to type up if interested.
fields.summary: Ability to Identify a Project as Internal

fields.description:
!image-2018-05-02-16-33-46-849.png!

These buttons have a normal arrow/text selection cursor when hovering them.
fields.summary: Make buttons have a hand cursor when viewing an issue

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
If "New Jira issue view" is disabled, *Time Tracking* fields (Estimated, Remaining and Logged fields) are not available in *Issue Detail View*. This fields could not be added in *Board settings* > *Issue Detail View* page as well.

Due to this, user needs to access the issue page and edit the issue, in order to be able to edit and update the Time Tracking fields.

Having these fields in the Issue Detail View could help to edit and update them quickly from the board page.

h3. Suggested Solution
As an admin should be able to add Time Tracking fields in the Issue Detail View.
fields.summary: Ability to update 'Time Tracking' fields in Issue Detail View

fields.description:
Hi folks,

Would it be possible to have an option added for whether or not to send a message to a channel when someone edits a message? The channels can get noisy when a few people are having a conversation in a case, especially when they are also fixing spelling mistakes =)

Thanks,
Padraic
fields.summary: Add option to choose or not to receive notifications when a Someone edits a comment

fields.description:
Allow admins to associate multiple workflows for each issue type based on conditional configuration, for example, Labels, priority, or some other field.

So once the issue has some condition met its workflow would change.
fields.summary: Allow multiple workflows per issue type

This page has a number of typos and formatting problems
fields.summary: Typos and formatting errors

fields.description:
h3. Summary

User profile is no longer able to select plain text format for email notifications
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login to a Jira cloud instance and go to /secure/ViewProfile.jspa

h3. Expected Results

User should be able to edit their profile to select the desired format of email notifications (Text or HTML)
h3. Actual Results

Users can no longer choose this setting in preferences
h3. Notes

User default settings can still be set by going to /secure/admin/ViewUserDefaultSettings.jspa and choosing txt. However this won't help existing accounts. This is only helpful for newly created accounts
h3. Workaround

You can still use the REST API for Jira Cloud as an alternative way to set your own personal email format preference:

Please see the REST API reference on [https://developers.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/#api-api-2-mypreferences-get]

You can then make a call like this in order to find your current setting: 
{code:borderStyle=solid}
curl -D- -X GET -H "Authorization: Basic STRINGREDACTED" -H "Content-Type: application/json" "https://example.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/mypreferences?key=user.notifications.mimetype" 
{code}
This will find your current profile setting.  Valid values for this property are either 'html' or 'text' (without single quotes).   Of course for this you will need to change the URL to match your Cloud site, and you would need to follow the steps in [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/software/jira-rest-api-basic-authentication/] in order to both generate a REST API Token, and then encode a Base64 string of your username:RestToken and then use that string to replace my 'STRINGREDACTED'.  This method uses Basic authentication. 

From there you can change your preference with a PUT command.
{code:borderStyle=solid}
curl -D- -X PUT -H "Authorization: Basic STRINGREDACTED" -H "Content-Type: application/json" "https://example.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/mypreferences?key=user.notifications.mimetype" --data text 
{code}
In turn this example command updates your own profile to use the text formatting.
fields.summary: User profile is no longer able to select plain text format for email notifications

fields.description:
h3. Summary

 

The Two Dimensional Filter Statistics Dashboard Gadget is not rendering properly the Component/s field content 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a Dashboard
 # Add the Two Dimensional Filter Statistics to the Dashboard
 # Add the Component/s field to the filter
 # The Component's name gets broken

 
h3. Expected Results

The Two Dimensional Filter Statistics Gadget render all information properly.
h3. Actual Results

 The Component/s field name gets broken

!Screen Shot 2018-05-01 at 5.37.09 PM.png|thumbnail!

 
h3. Workaround

No Workaround until this moment
fields.summary: Two Dimensional Filter Statistics gadget not rendering properly Component/s field

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When searching using the "Epic Status" != Done, it returns issues with the status "Done" even though it shouldn't.

The bug seems to be more around that marking the Epic Status as Done from the individual Issue page doesn't clear it from the Kanban Project Backlog's Epic Panel.
{code:java}
POST https://leicabio.atlassian.net/secure/QueryComponent!Jql.jspa 400 ()  {code}
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Search for Epics and use the "Epic Status" != Done
h3. Workaround

If you change it to Status != Done it works, but it bring other status that are in the category of "Done" too.
fields.summary: Using "Epic Status" in a JQL Query

fields.description:
When you edit an issue, if there is an user picker field set with an inactive user, JIRA won't let you update the issue till you set an active user for this field.

Some users don't want to update the user picker field to an active user, they just want to keep the current user being active or not.

It would be great to let the customer have the option to disable this inactive user validation at the edit issue screen.

User Scenario:
Business Analyst works with business team to gather requirements and create tickets around them. BA no longer with the company - leaving hundreds of tickets that cant be worked until an admin goes in and cleans them up.
fields.summary: Option to disable Inactive User validation at edit issue screen.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The option for exporting search results to HTML is not available

h3. Suggested Solution
Option to export to HTML is available.

h3. Workaround 
No workaround.
fields.summary: Ability to export search results to HTML

fields.description:
h3. ‌Problem Definition
When viewing an issue in Jira, it is quite difficult to distinguish if a user currently have access to the issue. This is especially the case if Permissions have been changed in the past, and the user no longer has access to the issue.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide some kind of label or "padlock" icon to show that the specific user currently does not have access to the specific issue. This can be shown when the user is a Reporter, Watcher, Assignee, or even when the user is mentioned.

h3. Why this is important
Sometimes, Jira administrators and users will expect that the user will be getting notifications for some events in the Jira Issue. However, if the user currently does not have the permission to browse the issue, the user will not receive these notifications. It will be very helpful if we can have a label or indicator to distinguish these users.

h3. Notes
This also helps to reduce the impact of other bugs, for example, the possibility of adding a user who does not have access to the issue as the Reporter. ([JRACLOUD-63213|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63213])
fields.summary: Provide a label or icon beside a username who currently do not have access to the Issue
Unable to Submit Feedback via "Provide feedback about this article"

*Summary*
When using Firefox, if adblock is enabled it's not possible to share filters. 

*Environment*

*Steps to Reproduce*
# using Firefox, enable adblock
# create a filter
# try to share the filter

*Expected Results*
The option to share the filter appears

*Actual Results*
The option to share the filter doesn't appear

*Workaround*
Disable adblock
fields.summary: When using firefox, if adblock is enable it's not possible to share filters.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After moving an issue from one project to another, the sidebar still shows the old(source) project.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create two projects (*Project A* and *Project B* for example)
# Create an issue in the *Project A*
# Move the issue to the *Project B*
# The sidebar in the Issue view still shows the *Project A*

h3. Expected Results
Since the issue has been moved to the *Project B*, the sidebar should be showing the *Project B*

h3. Actual Results
After the issue is moved, it still shows *Project A*, even when the issue is located in *Project B*
 
h3.Workaround
After refreshing the page it will show the right project in the sidebar.
fields.summary: After moving an issue from one project to another, the sidebar still shows the old(source) project.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a Project is renamed, the 'Recent' in App Switcher will still show the Project's old name.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project
# View some pages on it
# Rename the project by going to the Project Settings -> Details
# Go to App Switcher

h3. Expected Results
Under 'Recent', the project's name should be updated to the new name.

h3. Actual Results
Under 'Recent', the project is still shown with the previous name.

h3. Notes
* If you click on the Project's old name, you will still be redirected to the correct project.
* Clearing browser cache, or logging in through Incognito/Private mode does not help to update the Project's name under the 'Recent' in App Switcher.
fields.summary: If a Project is renamed, the 'Recent' in App Switcher will still show the Project's old name

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

At this time there's no simple way for an admin to wipe their Jira Cloud instance if they want a fresh instance

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide a function in Jira that will easily wipe all data if the admin desires to do so

h3. Why this is important

Admins may have set up a Cloud instance for testing purposes and want to start over whenever they begin using it for their production environment and have no quick and easy way to do this
 
h3. Workaround 

Follow the instructions on the following page: 

https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloudkb/how-to-reset-atlassian-cloud-instance-to-the-original-default-settings-including-removal-of-all-data-691012037.html
fields.summary: As an admin I want the ability to easily wipe all data from my Jira instance

Jira Cloud

h3. Expected Results

The text should be *Manage Jira global permissions*

h3. Actual Results

It was written as Manage Jira global *permisssions* .

h3. Workaround

No workaround

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Jira does not allow uploading Google Drives files to issues. Files must be converted and downloaded before it could be used on the issue's attachment screen.

h3. Environment
* Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Allow Jira integration with Google Drive
# Create one file using Google Docs
# Open an issue and try to attach the created file

h3. Expected Results
* File is listed as an attachment option

h3. Actual Results
* Files does not show on the list
 
h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
* Download the file and then reupload it to Drive
fields.summary: Jira does not list files in Google Drive default file format on attachment screen

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the "Manage dashboards" page, the "Shared with" column shows empty, even though it is shared with either all logged-in users, or shared with the public.


h3. Environment
- Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On the sidebar, navigate to Dashboards -> Manage dashboards. 
#- You will end up at https://instance.atlassian.net/secure/ConfigurePortalPages!default.jspa
# Create a Dashboard, share it with all logged-in users.
# Create another Dashboard, share it with the public.

h3. Expected Results
The Shared with column will show the correct value.

h3. Actual Results
The "Shared with" column will show empty, even though the Dashboard is shared with all logged-in users, or the public.
 !manage-dashboards.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
When navigating to the "Shared Dashboards" page, Jira shows the correct "Shared with" value.
- https://instance.atlassian.net/secure/admin/dashboards/ViewSharedDashboards.jspa
 !shared-dashboards.png|thumbnail! 

However, this page only shows the Dashboards that are shared with the current user.

h3. Workaround
On the "Manage dashboards" page, click on the ". . ." -> Edit, and you will see the Shares.
fields.summary: The "Shared with" column in Manage Dashboards remains empty, even though it is Shared

fields.description:
h3. Summary
It's not possible to create/edit or copy an issue collector if the project has a required read-only custom field

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a read-only custom field.
# Associate this custom field to a project accordingly.
# Go to a project, and create an issue collector.
# Access the field configuration and set the recently created custom field as *required*.
# Try to edit/copy the existing issue collector or create a new one.

h3. Expected Results
Edit/copy is correctly applied, and it's possible to create a new custom field.

h3. Actual Results
You got stuck in the create form, and also it's not possible to copy or edit existing issue collectors.
If you try to use a different issue type you get the following error message:
{code}
You cannot create an issue collector for this project, because the following fields are required on the project and those field types cannot be displayed to anonymous users. If the field is changed to be optional or a default value is provided, then an issue collector can be created for the project. Not allowed fields: <Custom field name>
{code}
  !issue-collector-error.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
- In this recording it's possible to see the problem being reproduced:
 [^issue-collector-test.mp4] 

h3.Workaround
- Go to field configuration and mark the affected field as *Optional*
fields.summary: It's not possible to create/edit or copy an issue collector if the project has a required read-only custom field

fields.description: I cannot test until the developers are done. I have several testing tasks waiting on various other people. It would by nice if my tasks sitting in the TODO column could change appearance to make it fast and easy to know that all required work it is depending on is ready. I currently have to click on each and every one of my tasks to check if other people are done.
fields.summary: Testing Task changes appearance to show other people are done with their work.

fields.description:
h3.Summary

There have been reports of webhooks failing randomly causing third party add-on (and other services that relied on webhooks) to not work properly. Investigation is currently being done on the matter by our internal team.  Currently we don't have much information what is causing this yet.

This bug ticket will be updated as we have more information of the problem.
fields.summary: Webhooks are failing randomly

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the _New Issue view_, when one wants to adjust the _Start date and time_, the only time interval available is between 9am and 6pm

h3. Environment
Jira Software Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In the _Sprint view_ screen of a Scrum Project, click one of the issues and notice the _New Issue view_ (pop-up).
# Attempt to log time by clicking the *+* sign next to _Time tracking_. This should only work if the issue already has some time logged. 
# Attempt to edit the *Date started* by clicking the calendar sign next to it
# Notice the time picker only shows the 9am - 6pm time interval

h3. Expected Results
The time picker should show a whole day time interval

h3. Actual Results
The time picker only shows 9am - 6pm, in 30 minutes increments


h3.Workaround
There are currently 2 workarounds:

# Disable _New Jira issue view_ under *Profile* → *Labs* section. This will bring the old issue view with another date/time picker
# Edit the *Date started* field in another screen. This can be achieved by clicking on the issue key on top of the _New Issue view_
fields.summary: time picker in new issue view only shows hours from 9:00am to 6:00pm

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Default unit for time tracking does not work in the new Issue view on JIRA Software Boards.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to *Time tracking* settings and set the *Default unit for time tracking* to *Hour* (or any other unit)
# Have the *New Jira issue view* enabled in *Labs*
# Log time on any Board without specifying the unit (eg: 6) 

h3. Expected Results
6 hours of time is supposed to be logged without having to specify the unit (eg: 6h)

h3. Actual Results
You get an error asking to specify the unit (hour, minute...)
 !KAN_board_-_Agile_Board_-_JIRA.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
This is specifically on Boards in the new issue view.

h3.Workaround
You need to specify the unit of measurement (hour, minute, sec,..)
fields.summary: Default unit for time tracking not working

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When importing issues via JSON import which includes associating the issues to Sprints, the importer does not validate if the associated Sprints are active/future/completed Sprints. This can cause the issues to be in an invalid state, if the issues are associated with multiple active or future Sprints.
h3. Environment
 - Atlassian Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create 2 or more future Sprints.
 # Import a JSON file which associates an issue to both of these future Sprints.
 -- Here is an example of the JSON file (ensure that the "value" in the Sprint field points to the IDs of the created future Sprints:
{code:java}
{
    "projects": [
        {
            "name": "ScrumSample",
            "key": "SS",
            "description": "JSON file description",
            "issues": [
                {
                    "priority" : "Major",
                    "status" : "To Do",
                    "reporter" : "admin",
                    "issueType" : "Bug",
                    "summary" : "Test Duplicate",
                    "assignee" : "admin",
                    "created" : "2018-04-11T18:49:50.161+0800",
                    "externalId" : "1",
                    "customFieldValues": [
                        {
                            "fieldName" : "Sprint",
                            "fieldType" : "com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-sprint",
                            "value" : [ "10,11" ]
                        }
                    ]                
                }
                
            ]
        }
    ]
}
{code}

h3. Expected Results

The import should fail, as this puts the issue in an invalid state.
h3. Actual Results

The import will be successful, and the issue will be assigned to multiple future Sprints. When navigating to the Backlog, clicking on the issue will return an error, which is described in JSWCLOUD-10652.
h3. Notes

Another observation that can be seen in the backlog, the issue will only appear in one of the Future Sprints, even though the issue is assigned to multiple Future Sprints.
!duplicate-view-issue.png|thumbnail!  !duplicate-backlog.PNG|thumbnail!  
h3. Workaround

Manually ensure that the JSON import does not import issues to multiple active or future sprints.
fields.summary: Lack of validation in the JSON importer causes imported issues to be in multiple Active or Future Sprints

fields.description:
Due to major changes in our Cloud products, some existing documentation from our official website blog are not up to date, which might cause users confusion when trying to follow steps described.

The free eBook [Jira Service Desk's Guide: Asset Management|https://www.atlassian.com/blog/jira-service-desk/free-ebook-jira-service-desks-guide-asset-management] contains outdated information related to what project templates exist in the current version of the product, for an example.

In order to prevent further issues from happening, it would be interesting if we could either *add a banner* mentioning that not all information in the documentation is up-to-date or even to *Deprecate* this documentation.
fields.summary: Remove / Deprecate Jira Service Desk’s guide to asset management Documentation

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Messages containing embedded images sent from Amazon WorkMail are not added as attachments to issues created via JIRA mail handler.

h3. Environment
JIRA Cloud
Amazon WorkMail

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a mail handler in JIRA
# Send a message from Amazon WorkMail containing an embedded image to the address for the mail handler

h3. Expected Results
Issue is created and the embedded image is added as an attachment

h3. Actual Results
Issue is created but the embedded image is not added as an attachment 
 
h3. Notes
Issue appears to be specific to Amazon WorkMail. Other mail provider's messages are processed as expected, with the embedded image added as an attachment. No error or failure is reported by the JIRA application logs when the embedded image fails to be attached. Mail headers from both a successful and failed message with an embedded image are attached.

h3.Workaround
Attach the images to the message rather than embedding it.
fields.summary: Amazon WorkMail Embedded Images Not Attached Via Mail Handler

fields.description:
The new cloud update introduced a new WYSIWYG form that does not support the same syntax as the old form, specifically related to {{{{{{preformatted-text}}}}}} and {{{{{code}code blocks{code}}}}}, but with other major inconsistencies as reported below. No clear documentation or link to said documentation can be found related to the new syntax, and the disparity between the two syntax schemes between the multiple forms.
 
New Jira Cloud updates have introduced input form inconsistencies. Please depreciate the old forms & syntax, and standardize the "code snippets" used across ALL forms on Jira. Developers like to type in code, please let us do so.
 
 It would be beneficial to the community to do the same across connected platforms like Confluence as well. As of now, there are at least three different syntax systems in place between software packages on the same cloud platform.
 
 h2.Expected
 All editors should work the same and handle the same syntax & styles.
 * sidebar issue description
 * sidebar comment
 * modal issue description
 * modal issue comment
 * detail view issue description
 * detail view issue comment
 
 h2.Results
 The detail view forms support different syntax than the (new) sidebar and modal forms
 * {{{{{{preformatted text}}}}}} is not supported in new form, which uses the standard of {{{{`backtick`}}}}). if you enter {{{{{{text}}}}}} in the new form, it will escape all curly braces.
 * {{{{{code}code blocks{code}}}}} typed out get all of the curly braces escaped
 * new form seems to support the industry standard of {{{{```}}}} triple backtick to start a code block
 * new form formats the following text: {{{{*text*}}}} as _italic_, where the old forms (detail) format the exact same string as *bold*.
 * new form uses {{{{**text**}}}} to format bold (as you type) which has no equal in the older forms.
 * new form also allows the user to type {{{{_text_}}}} to get italic, which gives the user two ways to do the same thing, causing confusion.
 * new form has no way of looking at the "code" for the content, forcing the user into WYSIWYG mode; for developers (this tool is used for software development, right?) this is extremely annoying, and a major step backwards.
fields.summary: Sidebar / Modal WYSIWYG forms don't match Detail form

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After editing an issue description through the new issue view on a kanban board, the save button becomes unresponsive after the first save.

h3. Environment
* Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a kanban board
# Add issues to the board
# Open one of the issues through the board
# Edit the issue description more than one time.

h3. Expected Results
Description changes being saved.

h3. Actual Results
_Save_ button does not trigger the save action.
 
h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
Closing the issue and re-opening it restores functionality.
fields.summary: Save button unresponsive on new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In the new issue view, on a business board, if more than one field is changed, only the first field changed has his changes saved. The other fields didn't save the changes made.

Steps to Reproduce

# Open a business board;
# Click on an issue;
# Click to edit "Due date";
# Click to edit "Priority";
# Close the issue view

h3. Expected Results

Both fields should have the values changed

h3. Actual Results

Only the first field changed has its value updated

h3. Notes 

The behavior happens if other fields are involved as well. For example, if you try to edit the description, due date and priority. Only de description will be updated. 

h3.Workaround
fields.summary: Edit more than one field in the issue view isn't updating the values of all

fields.description:
h3. ‌Problem Definition
When creating an issue, Jira will provide a list of Projects to determine where the issue will be created. However, if the number of Projects in the instance is more than 100, Jira will only show the first 50 projects, sorted in Alphabetical order.
 !project-list.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide administrators the ability to change this limit, to show more projects in the list.

h3. Why this is important
Providing a full list of projects reduces the risk for users to make a mistake and select a wrong project.

h3. Workaround
Type in a few letters for the name of the project, and Jira will return the relevant projects.
fields.summary: Provide the ability to configure the number of Projects that is visible in the drop-down list when creating an issue

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When editing issue from Jira core board page with the new Jira Issue View, users are unable to edit 2 times, for 1 or more fields.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to a Jira Core board
# Click on an issue, the new Jira Issue View will pop up
# Try editing any field, such as Assignee, Due date, Priority, etc.
# Once edited, click anywhere to save the changes
# Try to edit the same field again, or any other field
# The changes can't be saved
# Errors thrown in browser console:
{code} 
Uncaught TypeError: e is not a function
    at t._next (core-board.b365f3a8a71895ae624c.7.js:1)
    at t.__tryOrSetError (vendor.0debb4f58158dcd49eb3.7.js:1)
    at t.next (vendor.0debb4f58158dcd49eb3.7.js:1)
    at t._next (vendor.0debb4f58158dcd49eb3.7.js:1)
    at t.next (vendor.0debb4f58158dcd49eb3.7.js:1)
    at t._next (vendor.0debb4f58158dcd49eb3.7.js:1)
    at t.next (vendor.0debb4f58158dcd49eb3.7.js:1)
    at t._next (vendor.0debb4f58158dcd49eb3.7.js:1)
    at t.next (vendor.0debb4f58158dcd49eb3.7.js:1)
    at t.next (vendor.0debb4f58158dcd49eb3.7.js:1)
{code}

h3. Expected Results
* The changes to the field should be saved.

h3. Actual Results
* The changes are not saved, and user will need to close the Jira new issue view, and click on the issue again to edit another field.

h3. Workaround
* Close the Jira Issue View, and open the Jira Issue View again by clicking on the issue, and edit the field again.
* Refresh the page and edit
* Perform the changes from full issue view: https://instance-name.atlassian.net/browser/TEST-1
fields.summary: Unable to edit fields 2 times in new Jira Issue View in Jira Core Board

fields.description:
Problem
In Jira mobile app is not possible to customize the fields.

Suggestion
Make the fields customizable.
fields.summary: Customize the fields that appear on Jira Mobile

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If you remove one of JIRA's default issue types and re-create them with another *Type* they will be used for new projects.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access your sub-tasks issue types page.
# Delete or rename the default JIRA sub-task issue type: "Sub-task".
!default.png|thumbnail! 
!renamed.png|thumbnail! 
# Create a standard issue type with the name "Sub-task".
# Create a new project.

h3. Expected Results

JIRA should pick one of the actual sub-task issue types instead of picking the issue type based on the name.
This problem can be reproducible changing other issue types like renaming the current default Task issue type and creating a sub-task issue type with that name.

h3. Actual Results
The project is created with a generated issue type scheme where the created *standard* type issue type is picked:
!newproject.png|thumbnail!  
!2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

If there's no issue type with the name "Sub-task" JIRA will generate one with the right type.

h3.Workaround

# Rename the current standard issue type "Sub-task" to anything else.
# Re-create/rename a sub-task issue type to "Sub-task".
# Edit the affected issue type schemes removing the wrong issue type, associating the right one and moving the affected issues to it.
fields.summary: Renaming/Deleting the default JIRA issue types causes inconsistencies in new projects

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When a portal only customer is set as the reporter for example, in an issue that isn't in a Service Desk Project, the customer doesn't receive notifications about the issue.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow Portal Only customers to receive notifications of issues when the customer is the reporter of it, even when the issue isn't in a Service Desk project.

h3. Why this is important
In case we need to move the ticket to another project(non Service Desk) we need the customer to receive notifications of the issue.

h3. Workaround 
N/A
fields.summary: Allow Service Desk Customers to receive notifications of issues that aren't in a Service Desk project.

fields.summary: Jira Service Desk - Customer Portal Fields Not Customizable

fields.description:
Right now, if you make any mistake that automatically adds yourself/other users as watcher to hundreds of issues, you will need to open each issue and remove you and other users as watchers one by one, taking a massive effort.

It would be great to improve the bulk edit feature to let admins remove users as watchers from multiple issues at once.
fields.summary: Bulk remove yourself/other users as watcher from multiple issues.

fields.description: We would like to configure any add-on to be used ONLY for specific projects and NOT across the instance. This will enable us to only pay for the users within any given project instead of the entire JIRA instance.
fields.summary: Configure Add-on For Specific Projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Users with only the create issue permission cannot upload attachments

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Restrict the Browse Project permission of a project to Group A.
# Grant the Create Issue permission of the same project to Group B
# Configure the user to be a member of Group B and not Group A.
# Try to create an issue and upload a file on the create form.

h3. Expected Results

The file should be uploaded and the user should be able to create the issue. 

h3. Actual Results

The file hangs on the UI and does not get uploaded.  

!file upload.png|thumbnail! 

Furthermore, dev tools indicates that the call to the /rest/api/2/attachment/upload/project/<ID>/credentials endpoint fails with a 404 http code.

h3.Workaround

Grant the Browse Project permission to the user and implement issue level security on the project to restrict the user from seeing the created issues.
fields.summary: Users with only the create issue permission cannot upload attachments

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Fields are not represented in tabs as configured in the screens for the View Issue screen

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In the View Issue screen, add a tab with a custom field displayed on the tab
# Create an issue and set a value on the field in the new tab
# View the issue in the View Issue screen

h3. Expected Results
The field is displayed in the tab
h3. Actual Results
The field is not displayed in the tab
 
h3. Notes
The field appears in the tab for Create and Edit Issue screens

h3.Workaround
No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: View issue screen does not display field tabs

fields.description:
h3. Summary
As reported on https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/DEVHELP-1156 it appears that the default width for web panels is set to 300px. We should default this to 100%.

h3. Expected Results
Web panels in the new Jira issue view should be using the layout configuration present in the WebPanel configuration and scrollbar should be displayed if the content of the iframe is too big for the available space.

h3. Actual Results
Web panels always start with 300px and no scroll bar is displayed if iframe is too big

h3. Notes
The width can be adjusted using AP.resize(), but we should set a more sensible default (100%) in case they're not using this.

h3.Workaround
In the meantime, use AP.resize()
fields.summary: Set default issue content module web panel width to 100%

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
 - In all attachment windows, upon connecting to Google Drive, it only shows folders and files from 'MY DRIVE'
 - For Google accounts that have team drives, it will not reflect in the attachment window when connected

h3. Suggested Solution
 - Upon logging in Google drive, the window should reflect the same as in Google Drive and not only showing "My Drive".

h3. Why this is important
 - For team collaboration, team drives have been used to store files which is essential to be able to attach it to Jira

h3. Workaround
 - Copy the file from team drive and paste it in My Drive
 - Proceed to attach the file in Jira
fields.summary: Allow getting attachments from all drives in Google drive

fields.description:
h3. Description

Custom field values are not being saved when editing more than one field at a time in the quick view of the card.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open card.
#  Enter data in multiple custom fields.
#  Close card.
#  Reopen card.
Data is only saved in one field.  You have to edit the card multiple times for each field.


h3. Expected Results

All fields should save the value that is inputed during the quick view/edit process.

h3. Actual Results
Data is only saved in one field.  You have to edit the card multiple times for each field.

h3. Workaround
The only workaround at this time is to use the issue view/edit screen instead of the quick view from the board/card.
fields.summary: Entering issues into Quick View from Board on Multiple Custom Fields, only one value saves.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The feedback form in Business projects is not loading correctly.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Business type project and create an issue.
# Access the issue and click on *Give feedback* button:
 !give-feedback-button.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The form loads successfully, with the fields *Summary*,*Description*, *Name* and *Email* like in the image below:
 !give-feedback-form.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The form load only the fields *Name* and *Email*:
 !feedback-form-broken.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
- The problem seems to be intermittent. Sometimes the fields Summary and Description load correctly.

h3.Workaround
None.
fields.summary: The feedback form in Business projects is not loading correctly

fields.description:
Hi,

  With your new release, I cannot easily locate my filters ... need to open Issues, select Advanced, then select 'manage filters' ... your default filters automatically show when issues are opened.  Would like to see the filters that I need, in addition to the ones that you think I need.
fields.summary: Manage Filters available on Issues menu

fields.description:
*Context*
 After changes that occurred some time ago, values for the field "[CHART] time in status", should no longer be available in the table "customfieldvalue". When it does, Jira fails to delete issues

*Steps to reproduce* (When the unwanted data exists):
 * Attempt to delete the issue whose values for the field *"[CHART] time in status"* exists in the *customfieldvalue*
 OR
 * Perform a bulk delete containing at least 1 issue with value for *"[CHART] time in status"* in the customfieldvalue table.

*Expected results*
 Issues to be deleted.

*Actual Results*
 * Bulk operation fails with generic error
{code:java}
Error while performing bulk operation on issues. Please refer to Jira logs for more details.{code}

 * Standard delete operation gives a confirmation pop-up; however, the issue is not deleted.

*Workaround*

None at the moment
fields.summary: Bulk and Standard delete operation fail when table customfieldvalue contains data from "[CHART] time in status field"

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The "Test Details" field from Zephyr is not rendering when the "New Jira issue view" is enable and the user is on the "Full page view" (not accessing the issue from a board).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Try Zephyr;
 # Create a "test" issue type ticket;
 # Add some Test Details to this ticket;
 # Make sure the "New Jira issue view" is enabled in your profile;
 # Access the ticket

h3. Expected Results
 * The "Test Detail" and other fields from Zephyr are available.

!default issue view.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results
 * The "Test Detail" and other fields from Zephyr *are not* available.

!New Jira issue view.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround(s)
 * There is no workaround.
fields.summary: "Test Details" (and other fields from Zephyr) not available in New Jira issue view
Add condition to execute transition based on GPS location for JIRA mobile

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
After typing the client key and client secret on Jira, the application checks the OAuth information and the error is not specific when connection Jira to GitHub using an OAuth with a different callback URL.
!image.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solutions
Show a page with more specific information about what caused the error such as 'mismatch callback, your Home URL is different from the one set on GitHub'.
fields.summary: Error is not specific when connection Jira to GitHub using a OAuth with a different callback URL.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, all the saved filters are displayed in alphabetical order and there is no option to change how they show up in the Filters menu item on the Issues page.

h3. Suggested Solution

Create an option that allow the customer to customize how the filters are displayed in the filters menu on the issues page.

h3. Why this is important

This is important to allow user to decide which filters are more relevant to him to being shown first rather than organize in alphabetical order

h3. Workaround 
Currently there is no workaround
fields.summary: ability to organize saved filters differently from the alphabetical order

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In the old JIRA issue view a user can drag and drop attachments to the JIRA issue with enabling the editor or the media picker. 

 !drag drop to issue.png|thumbnail! 


In the new JIRA issue view, the drag and drop is only allowed when an editor is on or the media picker is enabled. 

 !new issue drag drop.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow drag and drop in the new JIRA issue view without any editor on
fields.summary: Allow drag and drop in the new JIRA issue view without any editor on

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In the new full page JIRA issue view, the attachments have no timestamps.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add an attachment to an issue.
# See the attachments on the full page view. 

h3. Expected Results

There should be timestamps on the attachments as it was on the old issue view. 
 !old view.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Actual Results
No timestamps for the attachments
 !attachment timestamps.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: No timestamps for attachments in the new jira issue view

fields.description:
Problem
Every time we end a sprint, every person in the team gets several HUNDRED e-mails about every task which left the sprint, and then again when the tasks are assigned to the following sprint.

Suggestion
Please modify the notification options to allow this to be disabled.
fields.summary: Option to prevent notifications when a sprint is changed.

fields.description: I see these kinds of issues throughout Jira:
fields.summary: Contextual History for all user interactions

fields.description:

  !Screen Shot 2018-04-19 at 5.25.45 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Verifying the Problem:
 * The application logs return an error message mentioning an IllegalState.Exception, as in the example below:

fields.description:
_Summary_

It is an inconsistent bug. Some users are not able to upload files by using the 'drag and drop', only on Windows 7, using Chrome version 66.0.3359.117 (Official Build) (64-bit). However, it is possible to upload using the 'Browse files'.
  
 _Steps to reproduce_
 # Open an issue
 # Select a file from any folder and drag into the upload box

_Expected Results_

The file will be uploaded.

_Actual Results_

It is not possible to even start the upload, as when you drag the file the pointer changes to a forbidden icon.   !sign_forbidden.png|width=15,height=15!
fields.summary: Not able to upload files using the 'Drag and drop'

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Jira Mobile shows only the rightmost column for all business project templates: Project Management, Task tracking, Process control, Content management, Recruitment, Document approval, Lead tracking, and Procurement. 

h3. Environment
* IOS 11.2.7
* Jira - v53.0.0.516

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Using a pc, create one of those business projects. 
# Create some issues on that project.
# Access that project through the Jira mobile app. 

h3. Expected Results
All the column are shown as it happens with Jira Software based projects. 
!image.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
Only the rightmost column is shown. Even when we try to swipe to the other right/left, that same column is displayed. 
!image.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Jira only shows the rightmost column of business projects templates on IOS app.

fields.description:
h3. Summary:

When looking to a pull request from development section within a Jira issue, data is inconsistent regarding the reviewer field.
h3. Steps to reproduce:
 # refer a Jira issue when creating a *Pull request* on GitHub. For example: _PROJ-2 #comment new pull request_.
 # Set a 'reviewer' to that Pull request on GitHub side (Navigate to *Pull requests* > click on the *reviewer* cog icon in the right column).
 # Go to that *PROJ-2* issue view > navigate to the *development* section at the right side and click on *pull request*.
 # You should not see the *reviewer* field filled.

However, if you set on GitHub any assignee(s) to that pull request, that assignee will take place on Jira as the pull request reviewer (unless the assignee is also the Pull request author).

 h3. Expected Results
 The reviewer from GitHub is the same listed on Jira.
h3. Actual Results

Jira is getting the assignee field from GitHub as the reviewer.
 !image.png|thumbnail!
 !image1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Jira is getting the assignee field from GitHub as the reviewer.

fields.description:
I would like to be able to choose the funktion Assign to Projekt lead in a post transition. 
!image-2018-04-19-09-20-14-366.png!

 

I have selected transitions, where we would like issues to be assigned to project lead, for them to take action. 

 

Alternative Project lead, could be choosen in field value.  We cann't use Automatic, as we don't want all issues to be assigned to Projekt lead when they are created.  

 

!image-2018-04-19-09-21-01-039.png!
fields.summary: Ability "Assign to Projekt Lead" in Post function

fields.description:
Attempts to add subscriptions to Jira filters using the [filter edit endpoint|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/#api-api-2-filter-id-put] does not work using objects derived from the [GET method|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/#api-api-2-filter-id-get].

There is a method for [adding share permissions using the API|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/#api-api-2-filter-id-permission-post] which also seems to imply that you require an additional endpoint for editing many of the values that could be sent to the update endpoint.

Please add a new endpoint, and/or make the documentation more clear on which endpoints can modify which values.
fields.summary: Create REST API Endpoint to allow adding subscriptions to Jira filters

fields.description:
Hi,

As per requested by the user, it would be appreciated if Jira allowed users to change the format of the fields. For example:

User creates a date/time picker field, and populates it in many issues. Then it is necessary to change this field to date selection only, no time selection. It would be interesting if user could change the format, then Jira would remove the hour and keep only the date.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Allow users to change field format

fields.description:
h3.Summary

As suggested by the title, email clients like Gmail does not support  vector images like .svg (which we are currently using as default avatar images). Due to this, the default avatars are not loading on JIRA notifications. This might be related to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59523.
fields.summary: Use .jpeg or .png for default avatars as some mail clients doesn't support .svg images

fields.description:
Original issue: [https://product-fabric.atlassian.net/browse/NP-75]

This is happening for 2 sites, which causes 500 responses to be returned from /rest/product-fabric/1.0/notifiedusers. The offending users should probably be removed.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, any users, including the system users, are showing on the Assignee field as long as the account is granted to "Assignable Users" project permission.

That being said, we are able to assign the issues to any system users like add-on users.

h3. Suggested Solution
JIRA should prevent the system users to show on User Picker fields.

h3. Why this is important
* This would create confusion for the regular users as they might not aware the user is a system user
fields.summary: Prevent System Users to Show on User Picker fields

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 31 May 2018|borderColor=#3C78B5|bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,

We have released a series of improvements to the "Export for Server" feature in Jira Cloud to clarify the limitations regarding Next-Gen projects and export for Server. Since Next-Gen managed projects are not yet available in Server, the supported export path is to migrate the issues in Next-Gen projects to other projects that you have created, then delete the Next-Gen projects.

Our hope is that the changes we have made to the export process will make it faster and easier to resolve this issue. We have also updated the documentation about exporting from Jira Cloud to Jira Server to make it easier to follow.

Please note that if you are a Jira Administrator and you want to restrict the ability to create Next-Gen projects, you can do so by reviewing the groups that are granted the *Create Next-Gen Projects* global permission.

Regards,
Dave Meyer
Jira Cloud Product Management
{panel}

h3. Summary
If there are [Next-Gen|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/managing-independent-projects-942834582.html] on the instance, the option to Create Backup for Server disappears

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Next-Gen Project
# Try to create a backup for Server

h3. Expected Results
The option to create a backup for Server is available the backup is created properly.

h3. Actual Results
The option to Create a backup for Server is no longer available, and the following message is shown:
{quote}
Your site contains Next-Gen projects. Jira Software Server and Data Center don't support these. If you want to create a server backup, contact support.
{quote}

h3.Workaround
Create a regular project and move the issues from the Next-Gen Project to the newly created project. Then delete the Next-Gen Projects.
fields.summary: Unable to generate backup for Server when there is a Next-Gen Project in the instance

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

From a user perspective, the screens of the 'External System Import option' (Settings>System>External System Import) and the 'Import issues from CSV' option (Issues>Search for issues>...>Import issues from CSV) seem identical. The fact that they have different functionality can be confusing for administrators. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Merge them to be the same and controlling any limitations through permissions or making the screens clearly different.
fields.summary: Merge import from CSV options

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 6th May 2021}
h4. Hi everyone, 

Work for fixing this bug has begun! This ticket is a priority we're currently working on and will be done shortly. Make sure to watch this bug for updates on our progress. 

Regards, 

Atlassian
{panel}
h3. 

Summary

Even though the *Time display format* Time tracking global setting is configured to *Hours*, the Time estimate field in the new issue detail view (both the backlog view and in the active sprint pop-up view) will still display it in *Weeks/days/hours*, including the placeholder example in the Time Spent field:
 !Screen Shot 2018-04-17 at 1.38.37 PM.png|thumbnail! !Screen Shot 2018-04-17 at 1.39.03 PM.png|thumbnail! !Screen Shot 2020-02-19 at 16.02.07.png|thumbnail!
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Change the Time tracking global settings:

 # Jira home -> *Settings* -> *Issues* -> *Time tracking*;
 # Click on *Edit global settings* -> set the *Time display format* field to *Hours*.

 * Change the estimation setting in the board:

 # Elipses button -> *Board settings* -> *Estimation*;
 # Change the *Estimation Statistic* option to *Original Time estimate*.

 * Now test a time estimate value input in a issue in the backlog:

 # Select an issue in the backlog so the detail -> set *1d* in the Time estimate field;
 # You'll see that the estimate value is correct converted to working hours in the backlog view (right to the card), but in the detail view, the value will be displayed in days.

h3. Expected Results

The detail view should display the time estimate in hours, like the global setting was configured.
h3. Actual Results

The Time estimate value is still displayed in Weeks/days/hours.
h3. Workaround

You can set your working days per week or working hours per day to a higher value than any one ticket's time log would reach. For example:
 - Set your working hours per day to 1000 to replicate format=hours
 - Set your working days per week to 100 to replicate format=days
fields.summary: New issue detail view won't display the Time estimate in hours

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Field updates does not trigger webhook for transitions with custom event.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom event
# Create a webhook that triggers on Issue Updated event
# Edit the workflow transition and configure a screen that can update fields. 
# Edit the transition's post function to fire the custom event instead of the generic event.
# Publish the workflow
# Use the transition and edit some fields on the screen

h3. Expected Results

JIRA should still catch that the fields (via the transition screen) was updated and trigger the webhook.

h3. Actual Results

The custom event is fired and JIRA webhook is not able to catch that the fields were updated.
fields.summary: Field updates does not trigger webhook for transitions with custom event

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently the Epic Burndown report displays the sprints that are not containing the issues in the epic. This makes the report quite complicated and hard to understand, as when the user selects an Epic, user expects that the report shows only the sprints that contains epic's issues. 

h3. Suggested Solution
When user selects an Epic in "Epic Burndown" report, it shows only those sprints that contains the issues associated to the selected epic.
fields.summary: Epic Burndown report should show only the sprints as per selected Epic

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

On JIRA cloud, HTMLs on field values is a [restricted functionality|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/restricted-functions-in-jira-cloud-applications-776636921.html]. This means that there is not a lot of flexibility in terms of formatting in the message custom field.
fields.summary: Allow text formatting in message custom field

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As an outsourcing dev company, we are often given access to certain projects in other companies' Jira Cloud sites. At this moment we cannot create a dashboard in our own Jira site to include issues or projects from the other Jira sites we were given access to, even if the Jira sites are linked to each other using Application Links

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the possibility of seeing issues from other linked sites and also add them to various dashboards


h3. Workaround
One workaround is to link our Confluence site to other companies' Jira sites, create an empty page in our Confluence and place 2 or multiple "JIRA Issue/Filter" macros, one for each linked Jira instance
fields.summary: show issues from linked Jira instances in one dashboard

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

* Currently for someone to access the different Atlassian sites in which he is a user, he has to bookmark the page on his browser or remember the URL link.

h3. Suggested Solution
* It would be a better user experience if the navigation bar or the https://id.atlassian.com page, or a “My Atlassian Home” page have a list of sites and products the user has access to and can navigate through.
 
h3. Why this is important
* Quick navigation, more productive UX.

h3. Workaround 
* As mentioned above for now the access is browser related.
fields.summary: List for users the different Atlassian sites they have access to

fields.description:
h3. Summary
New issue view show disabled options on a Select List (single choice) custom field.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Select List custom field with some options by accessing Jira Settings > Issues > Custom field > Add custom field. 
# Add that custom field to a screen.
# Access that's custom field setting page and disable some of the options. 
# Go to the project where that screen is placed and with the new issue view enabled, try to edit that custom field option. 

As an example of how the configurations should be:
!customfieldconfiguration.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results
The only options shown are those enabled (as we can see on the old issue view).
!oldissueview.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
All options are displayed.
!newissueview.png|thumbnail!

h3.Solution / Workaround
- Disable the new issue view. For that follow the steps below:
{panel:borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#6A8EB3 |bgColor=#F8F8F8}
# Select your avatar and choose Profile
# Turn off the New Jira issue view toggle under Labs
{panel}

- Access the issue by clicking on the issue name at the top of the new issue view card.
fields.summary: New Issue View show disabled options of a custom field.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, the official Jira Cloud mobile app does not provide a widget showing the issues in a 'To do list' format.

h3. Suggested Solution

It would be useful to have a work "to do list" that is always a swipe away on the mobile device.
fields.summary: Widget for Jira Cloud Official mobile app

fields.description:
*Summary*
 Not all keyboard shortcuts are working in Jira's new issue view.

 
||Operation||Shortcut||Status||
|Edit issue|e|{color:#4c9aff}Not applicable to new issue view as there is no edit modal{color}|
|Assign issue|a|{color:#00875a}Working (field must be added to screen configuration){color}|
|Comment on issue|m|{color:#00875a}Working{color}|
|Watch issue|w|{color:#00875a}Working{color}|
|Open issue|o|{color:#de350b}Not working{color}|
|Share issue|s|{color:#de350b}Not working{color}|
|Edit issue labels|l|{color:#00875a}Working (field must be added to screen configuration){color}|
|Assign to me|i|{color:#00875a}Working{color}|
|Jump to fields for editing|,|{color:#00875a}Will be replaced by dot "." menu. See next row.{color}|
|Dot "." action menu|.|{color:#00875a}Tracked elsewhere, see JRACLOUD-71827{color}|

 

*Expected Results*
 All relevant keyboard shortcuts work in the new issue view

*Actual Results*
 Nothing happens when using a keyboard shortcut that is not supported.

*Workaround*

There is no workaround.
fields.summary: Missing keyboard shortcuts in Jira's new issue view
